bug.short_desc: cannot see filenames with black background
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: If you have a black background, when you start caja, the filenames are not seeable/shown.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): caja-1.14.1-1.fc24
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. In 'Backgrounds and Emblems/Colors/', drag black to the caja background. 2. start new caja window and the filenames will not be shown/drawn.
Additional info: ctr-r reload does not show the names... but in new tabs, I can see the filenames. I suspect on new window startup, caja is missing some type of refresh/redraw/repaint event.
caja-1.16.4-1.fc24 mate-desktop-1.16.2-1.fc24 mate-settings-daemon-1.16.2-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-d31f603793

caja-1.16.4-1.fc24, mate-desktop-1.16.2-1.fc24, mate-settings-daemon-1.16.2-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-d31f603793

caja-1.16.4-1.fc24, mate-desktop-1.16.2-1.fc24, mate-settings-daemon-1.16.2-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
